001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Entity;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.AffineTransformation;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.NeuronFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.TrainableScalarFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
011import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.Activations;
012
013import java.util.List;
014
015/**
016 * Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.
017 * <p>
018 * A {@code Neuron} receives inputs from other neurons, computes a weighted sum with a bias
019 * (the pre-activation or "logit"), and applies an {@link ActivationFunction} to produce its output.
020 * The neuron caches its most recent activation so repeated reads are cheap until explicitly
021 * {@linkplain #deactivate() deactivated}.
022 *
023 * <h2>Computation</h2>
024 * For inputs {@code x₁ … xₙ}, weights {@code w₁ … wₙ}, and bias {@code b}:
025 * <pre>
026 *   logit  = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
027 *   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)
028 * </pre>
029 *
030 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
031 * <ul>
032 *   <li>Before activation, no valid output is available.</li>
033 *   <li>{@link #activate()} pulls inputs from upstream neurons, computes and caches the output.</li>
034 *   <li>{@link #deactivate()} clears the activation state so the neuron can be evaluated again.</li>
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <h2>Thread-safety</h2>
038 * <ul>
039 *   <li>{@link #activate()} and {@link #deactivate()} are {@code synchronized} to avoid races.</li>
040 *   <li>Weight/bias mutation is not synchronized; coordinate externally if used concurrently.</li>
041 * </ul>
042 */
043@DomainObject
044@Entity
045public class Neuron implements TrainableScalarFunction<Float> {
046
047    public static Neuron create(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes) {
048        return create(name, inputNodes, Activations.linear());
049    }
050
051    public static Neuron create(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
052        return new Neuron(name, inputNodes, new NeuronFunction(AffineTransformation.create(inputNodes.size(), JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT), activationFunction));
053    }
054
055    private final String name;
056    private final List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes;
057    private final NeuronFunction neuronFunction;
058    private final Array<Float> inputValues;
059    private float output;
060    private boolean activated;
061
062    /**
063     * Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
064     * <p>
065     * The parameter vector is sized as {@code inputs.size() + 1} where index {@code 0} is the bias
066     * and indices {@code 1..} are the weights corresponding to the {@code inputNodes} order.
067     *
068     * @param name           human-readable identifier for the neuron
069     * @param inputNodes     upstream input neurons in positional order; may be {@code null} for no inputs
070     * @param neuronFunction the neuron function to compute a forward signal
071     */
072    public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, NeuronFunction neuronFunction) {
073        this.name = name;
074        this.inputNodes = inputNodes == null ? List.of() : inputNodes;
075        this.inputValues = Array.of(new Float[inputNodes == null ? 0 : inputNodes.size()]);
076        this.neuronFunction = neuronFunction;
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Returns the neuron name.
081     *
082     * @return the human-readable identifier
083     */
084    public String getName() {
085        return name;
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Returns the upstream input neurons feeding this neuron.
090     *
091     * @return an immutable list (possibly empty) of input neurons
092     */
093    public List<? extends Neuron> getInputNodes() {
094        return inputNodes;
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Returns the neuron function.
099     *
100     * @return the neuron function
101     */
102    public NeuronFunction getNeuronFunction() {
103        return neuronFunction;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Returns the cached input values used during the most recent {@link #activate()}.
108     *
109     * @return a snapshot array of input values corresponding to {@link #getInputNodes()}
110     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
111     */
112    public Array<Float> getInputValues() {
113        if (!isActivated()) {
114            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
115        }
116        return inputValues;
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Computes and caches this neuron's output by:
121     * <ol>
122     *   <li>Reading outputs from {@link #getInputNodes()} into an internal buffer,</li>
123     *   <li>Applying the {@link #getNeuronFunction()} ()}.</li>
124     * </ol>
125     * Subsequent calls are no-ops until {@link #deactivate()} is invoked.
126     */
127    public synchronized void activate() {
128        if (neuronFunction == null || neuronFunction.getParameterCount() == 0) {
129            activated = true;
130            return;
131        }
132        if (isActivated()) {
133            return;
134        }
135        for (int d = 1; d <= neuronFunction.arity(); d++) {
136            inputValues.set(d - 1, getInputNodes().get(d - 1).getOutput());
137        }
138        output = neuronFunction.estimateScalar(inputValues);
139        activated = true;
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Indicates whether this neuron has a cached activation result.
144     *
145     * @return {@code true} if {@link #activate()} has been called and not yet {@link #deactivate()}ed; otherwise {@code false}
146     */
147    public boolean isActivated() {
148        return activated;
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.
153     */
154    public synchronized void deactivate() {
155        activated = false;
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
160     *
161     * @return the activated output value
162     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
163     */
164    public float getOutput() {
165        if (!isActivated()) {
166            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
167        }
168        return output;
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
173     *
174     * @param source the input neuron
175     * @return the corresponding weight, or {@code null} if not found
176     */
177    public Float getWeight(Neuron source) {
178        for (int d = 1; d <= inputNodes.size(); d++) {
179            if (inputNodes.get(d - 1) == source) {
180                return neuronFunction.getParameter(d);
181            }
182        }
183        return null;
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * {@inheritDoc}
188     */
189    @Override
190    public String toString() {
191        return name + "{" + activated + ", " + output + "}-" + neuronFunction.toString();
192    }
193
194    @Override
195    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<Float> getNumberTypeSupport() {
196        return JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT;
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * {@inheritDoc}
201     */
202    @Override
203    public int arity() {
204        return neuronFunction.arity();
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * {@inheritDoc}
209     */
210    @Override
211    public Float estimateScalar(Array<Float> inputs) {
212        return neuronFunction.estimateScalar(inputs);
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * {@inheritDoc}
217     */
218    @Override
219    public Array<Float> calculateParameterGradients(Array<Float> inputs) {
220        return neuronFunction.calculateParameterGradients(inputs);
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * {@inheritDoc}
225     */
226    @Override
227    public int getParameterCount() {
228        return neuronFunction.getParameterCount();
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * {@inheritDoc}
233     */
234    @Override
235    public Array<Float> getParameters() {
236        return neuronFunction.getParameters();
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * {@inheritDoc}
241     */
242    @Override
243    public Float getParameter(int p) {
244        return neuronFunction.getParameter(p);
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * {@inheritDoc}
249     */
250    @Override
251    public void setParameters(Array<Float> values) {
252        neuronFunction.setParameters(values);
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * {@inheritDoc}
257     */
258    @Override
259    public void setParameter(int p, Float value) {
260        neuronFunction.setParameter(p, value);
261    }
262
263    /**
264     * {@inheritDoc}
265     */
266    @Override
267    public void adjustParameters(Array<Float> deltas) {
268        neuronFunction.adjustParameters(deltas);
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * {@inheritDoc}
273     */
274    @Override
275    public void adjustParameter(int p, Float delta) {
276        neuronFunction.adjustParameter(p, delta);
277    }
278}
